answers.answer: HiWelcome to the forum!Evening rise in temperature is generally due to anemia, diabetes, hypothyroid states, overwork, stress and fatigue. It is also seen in diseases like tuberculosis.Since your stomach too feels queasy, there is a chance that you have inflammation of the bowels as seen in IBS, colitis or maybe even gluten or lactose intolerance. Discuss this with your doctor and try and get investigated.Hope this helps. Please let me know if there is any thing else and do keep me posted. Take care!

question: Hi.  I really hope someone can shed some light on my issue.  I have had low grade fever (99.6-100) for about a week now.  I feel okay in the morning, but as the day goes on, I start to feel fatigued and achy (in my legs and arms).  My stomach feels very queasy and hurts a bit too.  Sometimes my head hurts a bit as well.  It's very annoying and it's not the flu (I was tested).Anyone have any ideas as to what this can be?  It's frustrating.  I have 6 kids and hate being under the weather like this.
title: Tired of being sick
